page.title: 19Some thoughts on Newborough
page.content: { According to our survey}- about half the inhabitants know that most of our village is in a{Conservation Area}ie. "an area of special architectural or historic interest, the character and appearance of which it is desirable to preserve or enhance". { Almost everyone}thinks that the area is{beautiful}and they help to protect it by honouring the{'Country Code',} keeping their own properties tidy, mowing grass verges and planting trees. Most pick up rubbish, sweep the road and keep dogs under control. A watch is also kept on planning. { The worst eye-sores}at the moment are considered to be the dirty river Swarbourne, a spillage of sewage water on the road and the waste land by the brook. There are a few dilapidated cottages; some modern houses built out of character and electricity pylons.
